text: Do staff understand that card numbers must never be written down or stored on local devices?
hint: This reduces the chance of card data theft.

text: Is the payment system vendor listed and do you know how to contact them quickly for a suspected security issue?
hint: Knowing who to call speeds up response and reduces confusion.

text: Are default passwords on terminals or payment applications changed to strong unique passwords?
hint: Default passwords are widely known and can lead to compromise.

text: Do managers receive alerts for unusual refund activity or manual card entries?
hint: Alerts can help detect fraud early before losses grow.

text: Are staff trained not to request or handle full card details by telephone or message unless the provider gives a secure method?
hint: Unsecured collection of card details leads to data exposure and fraud.

text: Are payment and point of sale devices placed on a locked or watched counter area to prevent physical swapping?
hint: Preventing unsupervised access helps stop device swaps and hidden skimmers.
